text: Thomas Wade Landry (September 11, 1924 â€“ February 12, 2000) was an American football player and coach. Landry won two Super Bowl titles (VI, XII). He was born in Mission, Texas. He played for the New York Giants from 1950 to 1955. He coached the Dallas Cowboys 1960 to 1988.The Last Cowboy: A Life of Tom Landry in Publishers Weekly Landry died in Dallas, Texas on February 12, 2000 of leukemia at the age of 75. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1924 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:Cancer deaths in Texas Category:American football coaches Category:New York Giants players Category:Sportspeople from Texas
title: Tom Landry
